newsitem.title: JAPAN: Square sees robust orders for new game software. [Corrected 2:43 gmt 11/12]
newsitem.headline: Square sees robust orders for new game software. [Corrected 2:43 gmt 11/12]

text.p: Square Co Ltd said on Tuesday that it aims to sell three million units of its new game software "Final Fantasy VII" in Japan before the end of March.
A company spokesman said that although the new game would not hit the market until January 31, Square began receiving orders on December 1 and they had been robust.
He said Square had now sold more than 10 million units of its "Final Fantasy" game series, which was first launched in December 1987.

The first six titles of the series could run only on Nintendo Co Ltd's game console. The new title is only (corrects from "also") compatible with Sony Computer Entertainment's PlayStation game machine.
The spokesman said Square would sell the game software for 6,800 yen, mostly through convenience stores.
